org.vertx.java.core.http

Class HttpClientResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.vertx.java.core.http.impl.HttpReadStreamBase
      • org.vertx.java.core.http.HttpClientResponse
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ReadStream

    public abstract class HttpClientResponse
extends org.vertx.java.core.http.impl.HttpReadStreamBase
    Represents a client-side HTTP response. An instance of this class is provided to the user via an Handler instance that was specified when one of the* HTTP method operations, or the generic HttpClient.request(String, String, org.vertx.java.core.Handler) method was called on an instance of HttpClient.*

    Instances of this class are not thread-safe

    Author:
    Tim Fox

      Specify an exception handler for the response.
      abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllHeaders()
      Returns a map of all headers in the response, If the response contains multiple headers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here.
      abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllTrailers()
      Returns a map of all trailers in the response, If the response contains multiple trailers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here.

    • Field Detail

      • statusCode

        public final int statusCode
        The HTTP status code of the response

    • Method Detail

      • getHeader

        public abstract java.lang.String getHeader(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the header value for the specified key, or null, if there is no such header in the response.

      • getHeaderNames

        public abstract java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getHeaderNames()
        Returns a set of all header names in the response.

      • getTrailer

        public abstract java.lang.String getTrailer(java.lang.String key)
        Returns the trailer value for the specified key, or null, if there is no such header in the response.

        Trailers will only be available in the response if the server has sent a HTTP chunked response where headers have been inserted by the server on the last chunk. In such a case they won't be available on the client until the last chunk has been received.

      • getAllHeaders

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllHeaders()
        Returns a map of all headers in the response, If the response contains multiple headers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here.

      • getAllTrailers

        public abstract java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getAllTrailers()
        Returns a map of all trailers in the response, If the response contains multiple trailers with the same key, the values will be concatenated together into a single header with the same key value, with each value separated by a comma, as specified here.

        If trailers have been sent by the server, they won't be available on the client side until the last chunk is received.

      • getTrailerNames

        public abstract java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getTrailerNames()
        Returns a set of all trailer names in the response.

        If trailers have been sent by the server, they won't be available on the client side until the last chunk is received.

      • dataHandler

        public abstract void dataHandler(Handler<Buffer> dataHandler)
        Specify a data handler for the response. If the response has a body, the dataHandler will get called when some of the response body has been read from the wire. If the response is chunked, then it will be called once for each HTTP chunk, otherwise it will be called one or more times until the full response body has been delivered.

        If the response has no body it will not be called at all.

        Parameters:
        dataHandler -

      • endHandler

        public abstract void endHandler(Handler<java.lang.Void> endHandler)
        Specify an end handler for the response. The endHandler is called once the entire response has been read.

      • exceptionHandler

        public abstract void exceptionHandler(Handler<java.lang.Exception> exceptionHandler)
        Specify an exception handler for the response. The exceptionHandler is called if an exception occurs when handling the response.

      • pause

        public abstract void pause()
        Pause the response. Once the response has been paused, the system will stop reading any more chunks of the response from the wire, thus pushing back to the server. You may however still receive a few more chunks corresponding to those chunks which have already been read but not delivered to the dataHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.buffer.Buffer>) yet.

        Pause is often used in conjunction with a Pump to pump data between streams and implement flow control.

      • resume

        public abstract void resume()
        Resume a paused response. The response will resume receiving chunks of the response from the wire.

        Resume is often used in conjunction with a Pump to pump data between streams and implement flow control.
